title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:51  has quit 01:49  has joined #xwiki 01:51  has quit 02:02  has quit 02:04  has quit 02:18  has quit 02:42  has quit 03:20  has joined #xwiki 04:35  has quit 06:40  has joined #xwiki 07:03  has quit 07:08  has joined #xwiki 07:09  has joined #xwiki 07:33  has quit 07:35  has quit 08:27  has joined #xwiki 08:53  has joined #xwiki 09:03  has joined #xwiki 09:50  has joined #xwiki 09:56  has joined #xwiki 10:02  has joined #xwiki 10:14  has joined #xwiki 10:17  has joined #xwiki 10:49  has quit 10:54  has joined #xwiki 11:07  has joined #xwiki 11:08  has joined #xwiki 11:08  has quit 11:23  has joined #xwiki 11:35  tmortagne: hi 11:36 <+tmortagne> Chami: hi 11:38  I tried to solve that issue you gave 11:39  but I can't find any reason for that issue in the source code 11:42 <+tmortagne> Chami: did you tried to reproduce it ? 11:43   tmortagne: yeah 11:44   tmortagne: can you give me java class names of the REST search. may be I looked wrong sources 11:45 <+tmortagne> can you remind me  the jira issue number ? 11:46  http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5970 11:49 <+tmortagne> Chami: what is the rest URL to reproduce the issue ? 11:50 <+tmortagne> with the rest url it's easy to find the right resource and then the right java class 11:51  tmortagne: it's a simple rest search 11:51  tmortagne: sorry right now I'm working in a different computer. so can't give the address 11:52 <+tmortagne> Chami: how can I reproduce the issue exactly ? 11:53  tmortagne: create a page with the title like "C++ can use" 11:53  then if we try to search the page (using Ctrl + G keys) issue will arise 11:54  for an example if we type "C++" it will not show the result 11:54 <+tmortagne> Chami: search how ? 11:55  or if we type "can+use" it will show the page 11:55 <+tmortagne> with the search panel ? 11:55  yeah search panel 11:55 <+tmortagne> that's has nothing to do with REST 11:55 <+tmortagne> or you mean the real time search ? 11:55  but it send a GET request to REST isn't it? 11:55 <+tmortagne> before clicking on search button 11:56  in the search panel 11:56 <+tmortagne> ok let me see 11:59  has quit 11:59 <+tmortagne> Chami:  sorry I have to go right now, will ping you when I have the java class 12:00  tmortagne: ok, thanx 12:01  tmortagne: I will give you more detais after I reach my computer 12:17  has joined #xwiki 12:24  tmortagne: issue is in the panel which pops up when we click "Jump to any page in the wiki (Meta+G)" 12:29  has quit 12:30  has joined #xwiki 12:50  has joined #xwiki 13:15  has quit 13:45  has quit 13:51  has joined #xwiki 13:53   /names 13:53  is now known as 13:55 <@vmassol> hmm seems git is not so awesome as I would have thought ;) 13:55 <@vmassol> I created a new maven module, then later deleted it 13:55 <@sdumitriu> It'll grow on you 13:55 <@vmassol> I did a rebase -i to squash the commits 13:56 <@vmassol> and in the squashed commit it says the module is still there 13:56 <@vmassol> ahah wait 13:56 <@vmassol> my bad 13:56 <@vmassol> :) 13:56 <@vmassol> I have forgotten to remove it! 13:57 <@vmassol> hehe 13:58 <@sdumitriu> Classic PBKAC error 13:58 <@vmassol> ok rephrasing: 13:58 <@vmassol> git is awesome! :) 14:00 <@vmassol> ok going to push xwiki-commons changes 14:01 <@vmassol> sdumitriu: how do I merge my changes in a local branch into my local master already? git merge ? 14:01 <@sdumitriu> Yes, when you are on master 14:38  has joined #xwiki 14:52 <@vmassol> sdumitriu: how can I fix the fact that I have a local change on 14:52 <@vmassol> #       modified:   xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-albatross/src/main/resources/albatross/macros.txt 14:52 <@vmassol> even though I haven't touched that file 14:52 <@vmassol> I cannot git reset —hard 14:52 <@vmassol> it stays there.... 14:52 <@vmassol> and every time I hit enter in the shell I get: 14:53 <@vmassol> vmassol@vincent-massols-macbook-pro ~/dev/xwiki/git/xwiki-platform (slf4j \*) $ 14:53 <@vmassol> warning: CRLF will be replaced by LF in xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-albatross/src/main/resources/albatross/macros.txt. 14:53 <@vmassol> The file will have its original line endings in your working directory. 14:59 <@vmassol> reading http://help.github.com/dealing-with-lineendings/ 15:02 <+jvelociter> vmassol: question about xwiki-container 15:02 <+jvelociter> (hi) 15:03 <+jvelociter> is it "normal" that we can't get servlet request parameters from the Request interface / ServletRequest object 15:03 <+jvelociter> there is : 15:03 <+jvelociter> public Object getProperty(String key) 15:03 <+jvelociter>     { 15:03 <+jvelociter>         return this.httpServletRequest.getAttribute(key); 15:03 <+jvelociter>     } 15:03 <+jvelociter> but nothing to get parameters 15:05 <@vmassol> yes it's normal 15:05 <@vmassol> it's an abstraction 15:05 <@vmassol> now if you need stuff that are not yet abstracted out 15:05 <@vmassol> then you currently need to use: 15:05 <@vmassol> servletRequest.getHttpServletRequest() 15:06 <@vmassol> this gives you the original 15:06 <@vmassol> basically 15:06 <@vmassol> we're missing params right now 15:06 <@vmassol> (jvelociter) 15:09 <+jvelociter> vmassol: sure I get the abstraction thing 15:10 <+jvelociter> but shouldn't parameters be common to all requests? 15:10 <@vmassol> jvelociter: I don't know. Maybe 15:10 <@vmassol> (probably, just need to know how to handle them for deamon container) 15:11 <@vmassol> (the notion of reuqest is that one that needs to be handled for daemon cotainer btw ;)) 15:11  has quit 15:11 <@vmassol> to be honest we need something to take care of this container module again 15:12 <@vmassol> at some point I almost convinced mflorea to do that :) 15:13  has quit 15:15  has joined #xwiki 15:21  has quit 15:22 <+abusenius> vmassol: have you tried to do "git checkout -- xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-albatross/src/main/resources/albatross/macros.txt" ? 15:22 <@vmassol> nope but I think it's fine if I commit it, it'll disppear 15:23 <@vmassol> another git question: how do I merge with rebase? 15:23 <@vmassol> I want to do: git merge —rebase slf4j 15:23 <@vmassol> where slf4j is a local branch I have 15:24 <+abusenius> aren't merge and rebase 2 completely incompatible things? 15:24 <+tmortagne> vmassol: I think it's not merge then 15:24 <@vmassol> hmm maybe I need to pull —rebase on the branch against origin master 15:25 <@vmassol> before doing the merge on my local master 15:25 <+tmortagne> but last time I used rebase to merge things was not great 15:25 <+tmortagne> using merge now 15:25 <@vmassol> merge will create a new commit for me 15:25 <@vmassol> exposing  a local branch which isn't nice 15:26 <+tmortagne> i don't think so unless you have local modifications 15:26 <@vmassol> ok good 15:26 <+tmortagne> i mean in the master branch 15:26 <+tmortagne> let me check by commits on github 15:26 <@vmassol> doing a pull on my local branch against origin master fixed it 15:27 <@vmassol> tmortagne: I did it so I know it was creating it 15:27 <@vmassol> (the merge commit) 15:27 <@vmassol> I have done a git rest —hard to revert it ;) 15:27 <+tmortagne> without any local modification ? 15:27 <@vmassol> you cannot do that with local modifications anyway 15:28 <@vmassol> ok all done 15:31  has quit 15:39  has joined #xwiki 15:39  has joined #xwiki 15:43  has joined #xwiki 15:51  has quit 15:52  has joined #xwiki 15:53  has joined #xwiki 15:57  has quit 15:59  has joined #xwiki 16:07  has quit 16:08  has quit 16:14  has joined #xwiki 16:17 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: Do WYSIWYG tests run under FF4? 16:17 <+mflorea> wdym? 16:18 <@sdumitriu> I mean, selenium-tests don't run on FF4, since selenium doesn't support it yet 16:18 <@sdumitriu> Do WYSIWYG tests have the same limitation? 16:18 <+mflorea> yes, because they use selenium 1 too 16:18 <@sdumitriu> ui-tests, which use Se2, work fine 16:18 <+mflorea> yes 16:19 <+mflorea> the problem is with selenium 1 tests 16:19 <@sdumitriu> Maybe this is why jamesxu can't run the WYSIWYG tests 16:19 <+mflorea> no 16:19 <+mflorea> I told him to download FF3 16:19 <+mflorea> selenium 1 tests don't run at all on FF4 16:20 <+mflorea> i.e. the browser is opened but no test is run 16:21 <+mflorea> I showed him how to change the pom to run the tests with FF3 16:22  has quit 16:29  yes, I have successfully run the tests with ff3 following the Marius instructions 16:29  but when I am trying to run all the test, some of wysiwyg tests are failed or make errors 16:30  mflorea: Have you try to use mvn clean install to run all the tests? 16:32 <+mflorea> not in a long time, it's the job of CI server to do this, and as you can see http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/622/testReport/ there aren't that many failures 16:33 <+mflorea> I run only the tests that fail on CI, to reproduce the problem and fix it. 16:33  Yes, I have visited the ci, it is great 16:33 <+mflorea> you should look at the surefire reports to check why the tests failed in your case 16:34  yes, I will read it 16:34  actually, there are not many failures 16:34 <+mflorea> and then try to run each of them separately to see of the problem is reproducible 16:34  only two failed 16:34  but there are many errors 16:34 <+mflorea> yes, that shouldn't happen 16:35  ok, I will read the surefire first, is it under the target right? 16:35 <+mflorea> yep 16:36 <+mflorea> there is an xml format and a text format, check the text format, you should see a stack trace 16:36 <+mflorea> for each failed test or test in error 16:37  ok 16:48  has joined #xwiki 16:52  has quit 16:54  has joined #xwiki 17:00  hmmm platform build is failing for me with 17:00  [ERROR]   The project org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki-model:3.1-SNAPSHOT (/Users/vmassol/dev/xwiki/git/xwiki-platform/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/xwiki-platform-extension-repositories/xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki/xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki-model/pom.xml) has 1 error 17:00  [ERROR]     'dependencies.dependency.version' for javax.xml.bind:jaxb-api:jar is missing. @ line 37, column 17 17:00  checking why and fixing.... 17:01  tmortagne: could be caused by your commit? 17:01  indeed missing version 17:02  tmortagne: do you want to fix it? 17:02 <+tmortagne> well this is normal at this level the version was supoosed to be in core parent 17:03 <+tmortagne> checking why it's not there 17:05 <+tmortagne> vmassol: that's weird, I can see it in https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/pom.xml so i don't see why the build is failing, plus I did a local build before committing 17:06 <+tmortagne> vmassol: there is some failing tests but apart from this jenkins seems to build fine 17:07  it's on mvn3? 17:07 <+tmortagne> I don't think so but I am 17:09 <+tmortagne> and I don't see why maven3 would change anything for that 17:09  has joined #xwiki 17:09  hello there 17:09  I'm not sure that mvn2 xas checking for that 17:10  i'm trying to install the php macro, and i have a question 17:10  when it says "you need to install the following three libraries inside WEB-INF/lib" 17:10  does it mean to copy/paste or to use the import function in the admin section 17:10  or some other method? 17:11 <+tmortagne> vmassol: pretty sure it does, I already seen version missing error on jenkins or when I was using maven2 IIRW 17:11 <+tmortagne> jenkins/hudson 17:11  kutuzovas: it means copying on the filesystem where your xwiki server has been installed 17:11  xwiki is a webapp that's installed in a servlet container 17:12  as such it has a WEB-INF/lib directory 17:13  i thought so too, but when i started downloading the necessary files from those 3 libraries, there were to files with same name from different libraries 17:13  Quercus library (select the latest version)  and Resin utils (select the same version as the quercus library) 17:13  and this file "ivy-3.2.1.xml" is in both of them 17:13  did i miss understood something? 17:14  yes :) 17:14 <@sdumitriu> Why are you opening the files? 17:14  you need3 jars: 17:14  - the xwiki php macro jar 17:15  - the quercus jar 17:15  - the quercus utils jar 17:15  so i dont need the xml files? 17:15  for ex if you choose to use quercus 3.2.1 17:15  http://caucho.com/m2/com/caucho/resin-quercus/3.2.1/resin-quercus-3.2.1.jar 17:16  http://caucho.com/m2/com/caucho/resin-util/3.2.1/resin-util-3.2.1.jar 17:16  + the xwiki php macro jar 17:16  you only need the 3 jars 17:16  no xml, no md5, no sha1, etc 17:16  :) 17:16  oh 17:16  ok :D 17:16  didnt that 17:17  http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-core-rendering-macro-php/3.0-SNAPSHOT/ 17:17  so from here 17:17  only one of the jar files? 17:17  like  xwiki-core-rendering-macro-php-3.0-20110510.071219-448.jar 17:17  ? 17:17  what version of XE are you using? 17:17  3.0 17:17  then it's not the irght location 17:17  doc is bad 17:18  http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-core-rendering-macro-php/ 17:18  more specifically: 17:18  http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-core-rendering-macro-php/3.0/xwiki-core-rendering-macro-php-3.0.jar 17:19  hmm 17:19  i used the links from http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/PHP+Macro 17:20  well anyway 17:20  thank you alot 17:20  :) 17:20  doc fixed 17:20  :) 17:22  and the link for library to be able work with pdf 17:22  http://caucho.com/m2/com/caucho/resin/ 17:22  is this one right? 17:23  pdf? 17:23  yes 17:23  I don't understand 17:23  The missing modules are: bam, dom, pdf, and resin. If you want to use them, they are found in the main Resin jar. 17:24  (never used the php macro though) 17:26  ahah 17:26  [WARNING] 'parent.relativePath' points at org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki instead of org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-extension-repositories, please verify your project structure @ line 27, column 11 17:26  (for tmortagne) 17:27  that's why 17:27  tmortagne: you fix or I fix? 17:27  (same for other poms at same level) 17:28 <+tmortagne> looking but I don't remember having this warning 17:28  it's only when you run with -X 17:30 <+tmortagne> that's weird, server-ui is correct and not the others 17:31  has joined #xwiki 17:36  has quit 17:37 <+tmortagne> vmassol: fixed 17:37  k 17:41  works better now :) 17:51 <+tmortagne> I don't see why you had this version issue even with this parent error 17:52  btw jenkins had the same issue 17:52  ah no it's my last commit hmmm 17:52  ok becuase it hasn't built in the right order 17:53  tmortagne: maybe because I ran with -o 17:53 <+tmortagne> and you did not built from at least core root ? 17:53  grrr build failing on platform 17:53  same usual problem 17:54    initializationProcessorTimeGuessingTest(org.xwiki.crypto.passwd.PBKDF2KeyDerivationFunctionTest): The actual time spent running the function was over 100% off from the specified target time. 17:54  tmortagne: I don't know 17:56 <@cjdelisle> I'll look at that now 17:57  has quit 17:58  cjdelisle: thanks. 17:59  they passed the second time 17:59 <@cjdelisle> I've taken to not committing any test until I've thousand looped it 18:10  :) 18:12 <+lucaa> guys 18:12 <+lucaa> how can I get a piece of syntax rendered in the context of a document but without the surrounding

18:13 <+lucaa> ? 18:13 <+lucaa> in a velocity script 18:13 <+lucaa> actually it's not syntax, it's a little velocity script 18:14 <+lucaa> ftm I'm using 18:14 <+lucaa> $doc.getRenderedContent("{{velocity}}mylittlescript{{/velocity}}") 18:14 <+lucaa> are there any other ways to achieve this? 18:19 <+lucaa> found it, rendering as plain/1.0 does the job, but I guess won't work if there's also a bit of wiki syntax in that script 18:22  lucaa: hmm not sure anymore but we have an inline parser in some util class AFAIR 18:22  (from java) 18:23 <+lucaa> I need it in velocity 18:23 <+tmortagne> lucaa: if it's a velocity script and no syntax you should not use rendering framework IMO 18:23 <+lucaa> but how do I grab a velocity renderer? 18:23 <+tmortagne> I don't remember but you can look at what velocity macro does 18:24 <+lucaa> I need all these in velocity 18:24 <+lucaa> otrherwise I know how to grab a velocity renderer 18:24 <+tmortagne> hmm 18:24 <+tmortagne> isn't there a tool to evaludate velocity in velocity ? 18:25  maybe velocity is not the right place 18:25 <+tmortagne> or even an #evaluate macro or something like that 18:25 <+tmortagne> checking something 18:25 <+lucaa> tmortagne:  it still wouldn't work fully because i need it in the context of a specific $doc 18:25 <+tmortagne> ha ok 18:25 <+lucaa> however I think you can pass that too 18:26 <+tmortagne> problem is that to evaluate some velocity in teh context of another document you need programming right anyway unless you are the author of this other document 18:27 <+tmortagne> lucaa: where does this script to evaluate come from ? 18:27 <+lucaa> i'm in a .vm 18:27 <+lucaa> how are those interpreted? do I still need programming rights? 18:28 <+lucaa> I just want to allow velocity in the names of templates for the template providers, for the creation of a page from template 18:28 <+tmortagne> .vm is working like you script was in the current document AFAIK 18:29 <+tmortagne> and you need to evaluate the script in the context of which document ? the template ? 18:29  lucaa: do you still have build issues because I've just fully rebuilt everything up to XE and it worked well 18:29 <+tmortagne> s/templaate/template document/ 18:29 <+lucaa> the template provider 18:29  ? 18:29 <+lucaa> ( vmassol lemme check ) 18:30  http://ci.xwiki.org/ hasn't fully rebuilt everything yet though 18:30 <+tmortagne> lucaa: I think there is a type of property representing velocity content without syntax 18:30  kicking it 18:30 <+tmortagne> in that case you just need to call object.get 18:30 <+tmortagne> checkingg 18:30 <+lucaa> vmassol: still failing only the enterprise. What do I need to rebuild in platform? 18:30 <+lucaa> or should I wait for ci? 18:31  hmmm seems jenkins is building in bad order 18:31  I wonder if that's not a side effect of having enabled the 2 agents 18:32 <+tmortagne> lucaa:  found it: it's "velocitycode" contentType in texarea property 18:32  I mean having the agents in // will make this issue visible 18:32 <+tmortagne> when you display this property it just execute velocity on it 18:32  so a lot more false positives now :( 18:33  even worse it cannot fix itself properly, you have to manually tell it what to build 18:33 <+tmortagne> if not then it's a bug IMO 18:33 <+tmortagne> (still taking about velocitycode) 18:33 <+lucaa> tmortagne: hmm... I would so prefer not having to change the prop type 18:33 <+lucaa> to not migrate 18:34 <+lucaa> and I think I want it as an input 18:34 <+lucaa> not textarea 18:34 <+lucaa> all these because i need to translate this title 18:34 <+lucaa> I think we should somehow add a mechanism for this 18:34 <+lucaa> easily translatable properties 18:34 <+lucaa> automatically I mean 18:35 <+tmortagne> what do you mean by translate ? 18:35 <+lucaa> property values 18:35 <+lucaa> I mean localize 18:35 <+tmortagne> don't see what this had to do with velocity 18:35 <+lucaa> allow i18n 18:35 <+lucaa> $msg,get :) 18:35 <+tmortagne> so what you want is not really executing velocity then ? 18:35 <+lucaa> no 18:35 <+tmortagne> ok 18:36 <+tmortagne> what you could do is expecting the property is maybe a translation key 18:36 <+lucaa> however, we don't have a mechanism to check 18:36 <+lucaa> if a translation is successfull or not 18:36 <+lucaa> or do we? 18:36 <+lucaa> we do... I think... 18:36 <+tmortagne> and even if it's not a translation key the you will get it unchanged 18:37 <+lucaa> no you don 18:37 <+lucaa> don't 18:37 <+lucaa> you get the $msg,get 18:37 <+lucaa> if it doesn't exist 18:37 <+tmortagne> I don't think so no 18:37 <+lucaa> which makes me think 18:37 <+tmortagne> pretty sure it return the kay 18:37 <+lucaa> it means $msg.get returns null... 18:37 <+lucaa> lemme verify 18:37 <+tmortagne> it should not 18:37 <+tmortagne> it wasn't last time i checked 18:38 <+tmortagne> and even if it was returning null then it would ben even easier to know of that's a translation key 18:38 <+lucaa> yes, true 18:40  has quit 18:40  I don't understand why http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/116/console happens. I've manually rebuild commons on jenkins 18:40  (I mean I manually triggered it to build it) 18:41 <+tmortagne> vmassol: and commons built fine ? 18:41  yes 18:41 <+tmortagne> checking dates 18:41 <+lucaa> tmortagne: yeah, if it doesn't find it it returns it as it is 18:42 <+tmortagne> indeed commons has been built before platform 18:42 <+lucaa> however in order to have this complete, it would be interesting to be able to prevent translations from running, in case of colision 18:42 <+tmortagne> vmassol: the version is supposed to bee in root commons pom ? 18:42  yes 18:42 <+lucaa> but let's hope we have decent translation keys which are technical enough (which is so not true...) 18:42 <+tmortagne> lucaa: you can introduce some char 18:43 <+lucaa> I will pretend it will never happen 18:43 <+tmortagne> like "if it start with $ try to translate it" 18:43 <+lucaa> because i don't want to invent escaping 18:43 <+lucaa> I could reuse ~ 18:43 <+lucaa> but then I need to escape the escape 18:44 <+tmortagne> note that this system is what I want for general rendering translation anyway but with translation variable and escaping etc... 18:44 <+lucaa> if it's general it's fine 18:44  got to go, bb in 30mn 18:44 <+tmortagne> but translation module and rendering translation got lower place in priorities... 18:44 <+lucaa> but I don't want to invent it for this special case, because then I need to explain it, etc, it will be a particular thing... 18:45 <+tmortagne> lucaa: sure I agree with you 18:45 <+lucaa> I trust people can rephrase their stuff if they want it untranslated :) 18:45 <+lucaa> it's just a darn name, there must be a workaround in 90% of the cases 18:45 <+tmortagne> anyway having a real title that really looks like a translation key with dot etc... is not very nice 18:46 <+lucaa> tmortagne: yes, but you forget that we have some very bad keys 18:46 <+lucaa> just look at the top of ApplicationResources.properties "\_ 18:46 <+lucaa> :) 18:46 <+tmortagne> yea a bit 18:46  has joined #xwiki 18:46 <+tmortagne> but a title would probably with upper case first letter 18:47 <+lucaa> yes, I'm relying on this 18:47 <+tmortagne> :)
